item.title: Docker with Gradle: Getting started with Docker Compose
item.description: Docker Compose is a tool for defining and running entire application stacks in containers. Gradle plays well with Docker Compose and can automate the bootstrapping of those containers from the build process. In a previous post, I discussed how to use Gradle to start and stop a Docker container for integration testing. In this blog post, I want to continue the discussion by explaining how to manage multiple containers with Compose.
